perturbation.original_text:
5.  TERM

        This Agreement will remain in force for perpetuity or until and unless otherwise mutually agreed or amended in writing by both parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  TERM

        This Agreement will remain in force for an initial term of one (1) year, automatically renewing for subsequent one (1) year terms, unless either party provides written notice of termination at least thirty (30) days prior to the end of the then-current term. Notwithstanding the foregoing, this agreement can be terminated at any time by either party with or without cause, effective immediately upon written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the agreement is perpetual unless mutually amended or agreed to be terminated. The modified text introduces a fixed term with automatic renewal but then contradicts itself by allowing termination at any time by either party, effectively negating the fixed term and renewal clause. This creates uncertainty about the intended duration of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
2.1      During the term of this Agreement, LKPL will provide                   Axiometric with a license to use office space in LKPL's                   corporate facility in Columbia, Maryland, free of charge.

         2.2      LKPL will allow Axiometric to use enough office space for two                   individuals and associated equipment in locations convenient                   for LKPL's purposes for as long as that space is available and                   not needed by LKPL for its own purposes. Axiometric will have                   access to LKPL's telephone system, internet connections,                   conference room, and printers.

         2.3      If LKPL requires space used by Axiometric for LKPL's own                   purposes, then LKPL will attempt in good faith but without                   having any obligation to continue to provide Axiometric with                   comparable space. If LKPL deems itself unable to continue to                   provide Axiometric work space without expanding LKPL's                   facilities, and if LKPL determines it will be in its own best                   interests to expand its facilities, then LKPL will afford                   Axiometric the opportunity to lease space in the new                   facilities under a mutually acceptable separate commercial                   rental agreement. If Axiometric does not then wish to rent                   office space from LKPL, then LKPL may terminate Axiometric's                   license to use work space in LKPL's facility upon 60 days                   notice.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.1      During the term of this Agreement, LKPL will provide                   Axiometric with a license to use office space in LKPL's                   corporate facility in Columbia, Maryland, at a rate of $5000 per month.

         2.2      LKPL will allow Axiometric to use enough office space for two                   individuals and associated equipment in locations convenient                   for LKPL's purposes for as long as that space is available and                   not needed by LKPL for its own purposes. Axiometric will have                   access to LKPL's telephone system, internet connections,                   conference room, and printers; these services will be billed separately at market rates.

         2.3      If LKPL requires space used by Axiometric for LKPL's own                   purposes, then LKPL will have no obligation to provide Axiometric with comparable space. LKPL may terminate Axiometric's license to use work space in LKPL's facility upon 30 days notice. Axiometric shall have no recourse for such termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the office space is provided free of charge. The modified text contradicts this by stating that Axiometric must pay $5000 per month for the space and market rates for related services. Furthermore, where LKPL originally had the obligation to attempt in good faith to provide comparable space, the modified text states it has no obligation and can terminate the license with 30 days notice and no recourse. This creates a clear conflict regarding the financial terms of the office space arrangement.

3.5      Payments: As defined in section 3.3 above, selling parties may                   owe the other party some portion of the Proceeds. The payment                   of amounts owed shall be performed as follows:

                  3.5.1    Payments due shall be made within 45 days of the                            close of each calendar quarter.

                  3.5.2    Payments that are not received within thirty (30)                            days after their due date will bear interest at the                            rate of twelve percent (12.0%) per annum compounded                            monthly from the due date until such payment is                            received.

                  3.5.3    Payments not received within sixty (60) days after                            their due date will be considered a material breach                            of this Agreement and the party due payment may                            pursue any and all legal action to recover the                            payment and reasonable legal fees incurred in the                            pursuit of said payment.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.5      Payments: As defined in section 3.3 above, selling parties may                   owe the other party some portion of the Proceeds. The payment                   of amounts owed shall be performed as follows:

                  3.5.1    Payments due shall be made within 90 days of the                            close of each calendar quarter.

                  3.5.2    Payments that are not received within fifteen (15)                            days after their due date will bear interest at the                            rate of twenty-four percent (24.0%) per annum compounded                            monthly from the due date until such payment is                            received.

         3.5.3  Notwithstanding the foregoing, LKPLâ€™s obligation to make payments under this agreement is contingent upon LKPL securing external funding or achieving a positive cash flow from operations. LKPL shall not be in breach of this agreement for failure to make payments if such funding or cash flow is not realized.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states payments are due 45 days after the close of the calendar quarter, with interest accruing after 30 days past due and material breach occurring after 60 days past due. The modified text changes the payment due date to 90 days and accelerates the interest accrual to 15 days past due. Most importantly, it then introduces a condition that payments are contingent on LKPL obtaining external funding or achieving positive cash flow, effectively negating the payment timeline outlined previously. This creates uncertainty regarding when payments are actually due, if ever, and under what circumstances LKPL might be in breach.
